mdRecord.dcterms:title: Martha Washington's Room, Mt. Vernon
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Jarvis, J. F. (John Fillis), 1849-1931
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Stereoscopic view of Mansion's south lumber room, once believed to have been occupied by Mrs. Washington upon George Washington's death and formally titled 'Mrs. Washington's Bed Room or Chamber.' Later determined that Mrs. Washington resided in a different chamber on the third floor of the Mansion. A stamp on the reverse reads,'Fred A. Soules, 11 Phillips Ave., Hyattsville, Maryland.'
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Mansion Interior
South Lumber Room
mdRecord.dcterms:isPartOf: Historical Photograph Collection. Gift of Cheryl Marling, 2019.
